metadata.name: entity-ground-truth
metadata.description: Comprehensive annotated dataset for entity extraction evaluation. Contains sample documents with ground truth entity annotations covering all 18 entity types.
metadata.author: GraphRAG Team

documents.title: Invoice Processing Workflow
documents.content: The Invoice Processing Workflow is managed by the Accounts Payable Department. The AP Manager oversees all operations. Invoices are received through the Invoice Portal system and validated against purchase orders in SAP ERP. The Three-Way Match Task compares invoice, PO, and receipt data. Discrepancies are escalated to the Finance Director for resolution.

documents.title: Employee Onboarding Process
documents.content: The Employee Onboarding Process begins when HR receives a signed offer letter. The HR Coordinator initiates the Background Check Activity through Sterling Verification System. Once cleared, the IT Department provisions accounts using the Identity Management Application. The new hire completes the Onboarding Checklist Form within Workday HCM. Training assignments are tracked via the Learning Management System. The Onboarding Completion Metric measures time-to-productivity, targeting 90% completion within 30 days as our Primary Onboarding KPI.

documents.title: Cloud Migration Architecture
documents.content: The Cloud Migration Process involves transitioning workloads from the Legacy Data Center to Azure Cloud Platform. The Cloud Architect designs migration patterns while the DevOps Team executes deployment pipelines. Critical applications include the Customer Relationship Management Application (Salesforce), Enterprise Resource Planning System (SAP S/4HANA), and the Analytics Database (Azure Synapse). The Migration Runbook Document outlines step-by-step procedures. The Cloud Readiness Assessment Form must be completed for each application. Migration success is measured by the Application Availability Metric and Cost Optimization KPI. The Infrastructure as Code Template standardizes deployments.

documents.title: GDPR Compliance Framework
documents.content: The Data Protection Compliance Process ensures adherence to the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). The Data Protection Officer oversees all privacy activities supported by the Privacy Team. Key stakeholders include the Legal Department and Compliance Committee. The Data Subject Request Task handles access and deletion requests within the Privacy Management Application. The Data Processing Agreement Template governs vendor relationships. Compliance is tracked through the Privacy Compliance Metric and DSAR Response Time KPI. The Privacy Impact Assessment Form evaluates new processing activities. All procedures are documented in the Data Handling Policy.

documents.title: Change Advisory Board Meeting
documents.content: The Change Management Process governs all IT changes through the Change Advisory Board. The Change Manager chairs weekly meetings to review proposed changes. The CAB Voting Decision determines whether changes proceed. Standard changes follow the Pre-Approved Change Template while major changes require the Change Request Form. All changes are logged in ServiceNow ITSM with implementation tracked in the Change Calendar Application. The Change Success Rate Metric and Mean Time to Implement KPI measure process effectiveness. The ITIL Change Management Standard provides the governance framework.

documents.title: Security Incident Response
documents.content: The Security Incident Response Process is triggered when the Security Operations Center detects threats via the SIEM Platform (Splunk). The Incident Commander leads the response team including the Security Analyst and Forensics Specialist. The Triage Decision determines incident severity. Critical incidents follow the Major Incident Playbook Document. Evidence is preserved in the Forensics Database while communications use the Incident Response Application. The Mean Time to Detect Metric and Mean Time to Respond KPI track performance. All activities comply with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework Standard and the Incident Response Policy. The Incident Report Template documents findings.

documents.title: Quarterly Business Review
documents.content: The Quarterly Business Review Process is led by the Chief Operating Officer with support from the Strategy Team. The Executive Dashboard Application displays the Revenue Growth KPI, Customer Satisfaction Metric, and Operational Efficiency Metric. The Board of Directors receives the Quarterly Report Document. Strategic decisions are captured in the Strategy Alignment Decision. Performance data is sourced from the Business Intelligence Database. The QBR Presentation Template standardizes executive communications. All reviews adhere to the Corporate Governance Policy.

documents.title: Vendor Management Lifecycle
documents.content: The Vendor Management Process spans from selection to termination. The Procurement Department initiates vendor evaluations using the Vendor Scorecard Application. The Procurement Manager reviews submissions while the Vendor Selection Decision is made by the Sourcing Committee. Contracts are stored in the Contract Management Database and tracked via the CLM System. Performance is measured by the Vendor Performance Metric and Cost Savings KPI. New vendors complete the Vendor Registration Form and accept the Vendor Code of Conduct Policy. The RFP Template guides competitive bidding.

documents.title: Software Development Lifecycle
documents.content: The Software Development Lifecycle Process follows agile methodology managed by the Engineering Department. The Product Owner defines requirements while the Scrum Master facilitates ceremonies. Code reviews are performed as a Code Review Task before the Deployment Approval Decision. The Development Team uses GitHub for version control and Jenkins for CI/CD pipelines. Test results are stored in the Test Results Database. The Sprint Velocity Metric and Release Frequency KPI measure productivity. All development follows the Secure Coding Standard and the Code Quality Policy. User stories follow the Acceptance Criteria Template. Technical specifications are captured in the Architecture Decision Record Document.

documents.title: Financial Audit Process
documents.content: The Financial Audit Process ensures compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). The Internal Audit Department conducts reviews supported by the External Audit Firm as a key stakeholder. The Audit Manager coordinates activities using the Audit Management Application. Control testing follows the Internal Control Testing Task. The Materiality Threshold Decision determines audit scope. Findings are documented in the Audit Finding Report Document and tracked in the Audit Database. The Control Effectiveness Metric and Audit Coverage KPI measure program maturity. The Audit Checklist Form standardizes testing while the Working Paper Template documents evidence. All work follows the IIA Auditing Standard.

documents.title: Customer Support Operations
documents.content: The Customer Support Process is managed by the Customer Service Department. Support Agents handle incoming requests through the Help Desk System (Zendesk). The Ticket Escalation Task routes complex issues to the Technical Support Team. Customer feedback is collected via the Satisfaction Survey Form. The First Call Resolution Metric and Customer Satisfaction KPI track service quality.

documents.title: Data Warehouse Architecture
documents.content: The Data Integration Process loads data from operational systems into the Enterprise Data Warehouse. The Data Engineering Team manages ETL pipelines using the Informatica PowerCenter Application. The Data Steward ensures quality while the Data Architect designs schemas. Source data flows from the Transactional Database (Oracle) and CRM Database (Salesforce) into the Snowflake Data Warehouse. The Data Quality Metric monitors accuracy. ETL jobs follow the Data Load Template and comply with the Data Governance Policy.

documents.title: Regulatory Reporting Workflow
documents.content: The Regulatory Reporting Process submits required filings to regulatory bodies. The Compliance Analyst prepares reports while the Compliance Director approves submissions. Reports comply with the Securities Exchange Act and Basel III Accord requirements. The Regulatory Reporting Application automates data collection from the Financial Reporting Database. The Report Accuracy Metric and Submission Timeliness KPI ensure quality. The Regulatory Filing Form captures required disclosures. All reports follow the Regulatory Reporting Standard.

documents.title: Project Portfolio Management
documents.content: The Project Portfolio Management Process prioritizes initiatives aligned with strategic goals. The PMO Director leads the Enterprise PMO while Project Managers execute individual projects. The Investment Committee serves as the key stakeholder for funding decisions. The Portfolio Prioritization Decision ranks projects by value. Projects are tracked in the PPM Application (Planview) with data stored in the Project Database. The Project Success Rate Metric and ROI KPI measure portfolio health. All projects follow the Project Charter Template and adhere to the PMI Project Management Standard and Project Governance Policy.

documents.title: Access Control Management
documents.content: The Access Management Process controls user permissions across systems. The Identity Administrator provisions access while the Security Team reviews requests. Access requests go through the Access Approval Decision. Identities are managed in Azure Active Directory with permissions stored in the IAM Database. The Privileged Access Management Application controls admin accounts. The Access Review Task validates entitlements quarterly. Compliance is measured by the Segregation of Duties Metric and Access Certification KPI. The Access Request Form initiates provisioning following the Identity Management Standard and Access Control Policy.

documents.title: Production Scheduling
documents.content: The Production Planning Process determines manufacturing schedules based on demand. The Production Planner creates schedules in the MRP System while the Operations Manager approves production runs. The scheduling task is performed as a Daily Planning Activity. The Production Efficiency Metric and On-Time Delivery KPI track performance. Work orders follow the Production Order Form template.

documents.title: Risk Assessment Framework
documents.content: The Enterprise Risk Management Process identifies and mitigates organizational risks. The Chief Risk Officer leads the Risk Management Department with support from the Risk Committee as primary stakeholder. Risk assessments follow the Risk Identification Task and Risk Rating Decision. Findings are logged in the GRC Application and stored in the Risk Register Database. The Risk Exposure Metric and Key Risk Indicator KPI provide visibility. Assessments use the Risk Assessment Form and follow the Risk Treatment Template. All activities comply with the ISO 31000 Standard, COSO Framework Standard, and Enterprise Risk Policy.

documents.title: Marketing Campaign Execution
documents.content: The Marketing Campaign Process drives customer engagement. The Marketing Manager designs campaigns while the Digital Marketing Team executes them. Campaigns are managed in the Marketing Automation Platform (HubSpot). The Campaign Approval Decision determines launch readiness. The Campaign Performance Metric and Lead Conversion KPI measure success. Campaign briefs follow the Campaign Brief Template.

documents.title: Disaster Recovery Planning
documents.content: The Disaster Recovery Process ensures business continuity during disruptions. The DR Coordinator manages recovery activities supported by the Business Continuity Team. Recovery procedures are documented in the DR Plan Document. The Recovery Site System provides failover capability with data replicated to the DR Database. Recovery is orchestrated through the Azure Site Recovery Application. The Recovery Declaration Decision activates the plan. The Recovery Time Objective Metric and System Availability KPI track readiness. Testing uses the DR Test Checklist Form and DR Exercise Template. All activities follow the ISO 22301 Standard and the Business Continuity Policy.

documents.title: Strategic Planning Cycle
documents.content: The Strategic Planning Process defines long-term organizational direction. The Chief Strategy Officer leads the effort with support from the Strategy Department. The Executive Leadership Team serves as the primary stakeholder. Strategic priorities emerge from the Strategic Direction Decision. Plans are documented in the Strategic Plan Document and tracked in the Strategy Management Application. The Strategy Database stores objectives and initiatives. The Goal Achievement Metric and Strategic Alignment KPI measure progress. Planning follows the Strategic Initiative Template and adheres to the Strategic Planning Policy.

documents.title: Quality Management System
documents.content: The Quality Management Process ensures products meet specifications. The Quality Manager leads the Quality Department in continuous improvement. The Quality Assurance Team executes testing activities. Inspections follow the Quality Inspection Task with dispositions made via the Quality Disposition Decision. Non-conformances are logged in the Quality Management System (QMS) and tracked in the NCR Database. The Defect Rate Metric and Customer Complaint KPI measure quality. Inspections use the Quality Checklist Form and Corrective Action Template. All work follows the ISO 9001 Standard and Quality Policy.

documents.title: Budget Planning Process
documents.content: The Annual Budget Process allocates financial resources across the organization. The Finance Director leads the Finance Department in budget preparation. Department Heads serve as stakeholders providing input. Budget decisions are made through the Budget Allocation Decision. Financial data is managed in the ERP Financial Module and stored in the Budget Database. The Budget Variance Metric and Cost Control KPI track execution. Budget requests use the Budget Request Form.

documents.title: Performance Review Cycle
documents.content: The Performance Management Process evaluates employee contributions annually. The HR Business Partner facilitates reviews while Line Managers conduct assessments. The Performance Rating Decision determines compensation adjustments. Reviews are managed in the HRIS Application (Workday) with data in the HR Database. The Performance Rating Metric and Employee Engagement KPI track outcomes. Assessments use the Performance Review Form following the Performance Management Policy.

documents.title: API Integration Management
documents.content: The API Management Process governs integrations across systems. The Integration Architect designs APIs while the API Team implements them. The API Gateway (Azure API Management) routes traffic. API consumers including Partner Systems are key stakeholders. API publishing follows the API Release Decision. The API Catalog Database stores specifications. The API Response Time Metric and API Availability KPI measure performance. Designs follow the API Design Template and adhere to the OpenAPI Standard and API Security Policy.

documents.title: Multi-Domain Mixed Content
documents.content: The Digital Transformation Initiative spans multiple domains. The Chief Digital Officer leads the Digital Office while collaborating with the IT Steering Committee. The transformation includes the ERP Modernization Process managed by the ERP Team. Technical implementation uses the Azure Cloud Platform with data migrated to the Cloud Database. The transformation follows the Digital Roadmap Document. Progress is tracked through the Digital Maturity Metric and Transformation ROI KPI. Changes go through the Transformation Governance Decision. Implementation follows the Cloud Migration Template, complies with the SOC 2 Type II Standard and the Digital Transformation Policy. Budget requests use the Initiative Funding Form. The Quarterly Progress Report Activity updates stakeholders.
